item.title: When should we use useReducer instead of useState?
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Imagine we have a component with multiple states. It is simple enough not to use state management libraries. useState is surely a choice for the sake of brevity and clarity.

item.title: Preserving and Resetting state in React
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Why should you read this article? Understand how state in React works const [isPlayerA, setIsPlayerA] = useState(true) function Counter(name) { const [score, setScore] = useState(0) return ( <> <div> {name}: {score} </div> <button onClick={() => setScore(score + 1)}>+1</button> </> ) } // ---------- // Do you think they are the same?
